item.title: Star Wars: Battlefront 2's Best Version Is Free For Game Pass Members Right Now
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/star-wars-battlefront-2s-best-version-is-free-for-game-pass-members-right-now/1100-6528572/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Star Wars: Battlefront II's best and most complete version is currently free to keep on Xbox, but only for a limited time and only for EA Play members. Now through December 20, EA Play members can grab the 2017 game for the nice price of $0.00. EA Play is included with Game Pass Ultimate, so those subscribers get the game free as well.

The version of Battlefront II that's free is the Celebration Edition, which includes the base game and all past free updates. It has almost all of the content that was previously sold as DLC and microtransactions, so you're getting pretty much the complete package.

The Celebration Edition originally launched in December 2019 priced at $40, following on from the standard edition's debut in 2017. If you're not an EA Play or Game Pass Ultimate member, you can still get the Celebration Edition for a great price, as it's currently marked down to only $4.

Battlefront II had a challenging launch in 2017, as the game's early-access debut was criticized for its use of loot boxes. EA removed these in time for the game's public launch, though, and the game steadily grew and improved with new maps and modes over the years.

The new Battlefront games combined to sell more than 35 million copies, but EA was said to have rejected a pitch from DICE for a third game due to licensing costs. While the modern Battlefront series didn't continue, the classic Battlefront games were re-released earlier this year to a poor critical reception.

After Battlefront II, DICE would go on to release Battlefield V in 2018 and Battlefield 2042 in 2021. DICE is now working with a network of other studios on the next Battlefield, which returns to a modern-day setting and is reportedly on tap to launch in October 2025.

As for the Star Wars video game series, some of the upcoming games include Star Wars Eclipse from Quantic Dream and the next Star Wars Jedi game from Respawn, among others.

item.title: Lack Of GTA 6 News Is Frustrating Fans, Take-Two Boss Admits
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/lack-of-gta-6-news-is-frustrating-fans-take-two-boss-admits/1100-6528571/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

By on December 19, 2024 at 8:57AM PST

Grand Theft Auto VI is set to be released within the next year, and now the head of Rockstar Games' parent company has offered a few more teases about what fans can expect. Speaking to Conner Mather (via GTA VI Countdown), Take-Two boss Strauss Zelnick said the developers at Rockstar Games are trying to deliver something unexpected with GTA VI, even if that takes time.

"Our teams are focused on what's new that you haven't even thought about. You thought you were anticipating this thing but this is way bigger and way better and more exciting and more beautiful than you could have possibly thought of," he said.

Also in the interview, Zelnick said he understands that fans have become "a little frustrated" as Rockstar works in secrecy on GTA VI. But he said Take-Two's philosophy is to "wait for a title to be ready" before releasing it.

"I think [GTA VI] will be extraordinary and worth waiting for," he said, adding that he expects GTA VI to be "breathtaking."

Of course, part of Zelnick's job is to hype his company's products and use all kinds of marketing speak and buzzwords to get people excited, so hearing him say all of this is no surprise.

Another noteworthy tidbit from the interview is that Zelnick said he is aware of the GTA VI memes about "We got ___ before GTA VI." He said, "I've seen some of those."

GTA VI is set for release in Fall 2025 on PS5 and Xbox Series X|S. Every Rockstar Games title in the past decade has been delayed beyond its original publicly announced date, and some are expecting GTA VI to slip into 2026. Rival publishers are reportedly waiting to assign dates to their own games until Rockstar Games officially announces a release date for GTA VI.

In other news, a recent report said that with GTA VI, "Rockstar is asking its writers to be less crude toward transgender people and other minorities."

item.title: GTA Online Gifts Free Penguin Onesie, Festive Weapons, And More Treats For The Holiday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/gta-online-gifts-free-penguin-onesie-festive-weapons-and-more-treats-for-the-holiday/1100-6528570/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A festive update has arrived in Grand Theft Auto Online, bringing snowfall and holiday decorations to Los Santos. Players will receive free in-game items for logging in during this winter celebration, and there are returning seasonal events as well.

Those who log in anytime between December 19 and January 1 can claim a holiday stocking filled with gifts, including a penguin onesie, a gold reindeer pendant, a jacket and pants set, a snowball launcher, a fireworks rocket launcher with 20 rockets, and a fresh stock of snacks and ammo.

Four holiday events also return for the season: Weazel Plaza Shootout, The Gooch, Snowmen, and Yeti Hunt. Completing these events before January 1 will grant the following rewards:

  • Hunt down the Yeti to receive the Yeti Outfit
  • Take out The Gooch to receive The Gooch Outfit
  • Destroy all 25 Snowmen to receive The Snowman Outfit
  • Neutralize the criminal masterminds in the Weazel Plaza Shootout to claim the WM 29 Pistol and the Seasonâ€™s Greetings Pistol Mk II Skin

Players should be on the lookout for the Happy Holidays Hauler cruising around in-game. This vehicle is dropping additional gifts onto the streets of Los Santos, which include GTA$, RP, snacks, and ammo refills. It also guarantees either the eCola Festive Sweater or the Sprunk Festive Sweater with each pickup.

Additionally, all players earn 3X GTA$ and RP in the Entourage (Festive Remix) featured series. This holiday remix divides players into teams for a battle of elves versus Krampuses, and completing objectives can unlock bonus rewards:

  • Complete Entourage (Festive Remix) once to receive the Snowman Finish for the Combat Pistol
  • Win five matches of Entourage (Festive Remix) to receive the Skull Santa Finish for the Special Carbine
  • Win Entourage (Festive Remix) as Santa to receive the Santa's Helper Finish for the Heavy Sniper

GTA Online's holiday spirit also includes various vehicle discounts at Premium Deluxe Motorsport showroom, and two new law-enforcement vehicles are added to the game.

Grand Theft Auto VI is set for release in Fall 2025, and here is everything we know about the game so far.

item.title: US Justice Department Investigation Leads To Board Members Leaving Epic Games
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/us-justice-department-investigation-leads-to-board-members-leaving-epic-games/1100-6528567/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Epic Games has had its share of legal victories over the years, including one over Google earlier in 2024. But when it comes to the federal government, the United States Justice Department just came down on Epic Games for violating Section 8 of the Clayton Act, which was put in place to keep members of the board of one company from being able to serve in the same capacity on a competitor's board.

The Justice Department announced that two members of Epic's board who were appointed by Tencent have voluntarily stepped down after the government raised the Clayton Act issue through its Antitrust Division. Tencent is a minority owner of Epic, and also the majority owner of Riot Games, the company behind League of Legends. Epic has since confirmed that the two departing board members are Ben Feder and David Wallerstein. Additionally, Tencent has relinquished its right to appoint any additional members to Epic's board of directors.

"Our relationship with Epic has always centered on making great games and delivering great experiences for players and developers," said a Tencent spokesperson. "We look forward to continuing to work with them on this shared vision."

Epic subsequently announced that Feder and Wallerstein will be replaced by "two new independent board members [who] will be nominated by committees of Epic's shareholders." Feder and Wallerstein will presumably retain their positions on Tencent's board.

Tencent is also a minority owner of Ubisoft, which is currently in negotiations with the company about a potential management buyout. The Guillemot family--which owns the largest stake in Ubisoft--reportedly wants to maintain control of the company in any deal, while Ubisoft has been said to be in a "greater say on future board decisions" in exchange for any future investment in the company. For now, no deal between the two companies has been announced.

Earlier this week, Epic went to court to sue an alleged cheater, whom the company claims has used unauthorized software to gain an unfair advantage during several of the company's Fortnite tournaments, which allowed him to walk away with thousands of dollars in prize money. Meanwhile, Epic is still butting heads with Apple over the former's desire to build an app store.
